title: Blue Origin Space Launch Would Cap Busy Year for Human Spaceflight
sub_head: Jeff Bezos’ company plans third suborbital human flight in 2021 on Saturday, involving four paying customers and guests including Michael Strahan
body:
Jeff Bezos’ Blue Origin LLC is set to launch six people to the edge of space for a few minutes on Saturday, a trip that would round out the busiest year for human flights in more than three decades.
The company’s latest tourism flight has four paying customers on board: space-industry executive Dylan Taylor; Evan Dick, an investor; and investor Lane Bess and his child. Two guests who didn’t pay for their seats will be along for the ride as well: “Good Morning America” co-host Michael Strahan and Laura Shepard Churchley, the eldest daughter of Alan Shepard, who in 1961 became the first American to reach space.
